part1.converted_description:
You are given a set of assembunny code instructions. The code operates on four registers - `a`, `b`, `c`, and `d` - that start at 0 and can hold any integer value. The instructions include `cpy x y` (copy the value of `x` into register `y`), `inc x` (increment the value of register `x` by one), `dec x` (decrement the value of register `x` by one), and `jnz x y` (jump to instruction `y` away if `x` is not zero). Execute the given assembunny code and determine the final value in register `a`.

Input Format:
The input is a series of lines, each containing an assembunny code instruction.

part2.converted_description:
You need to modify the assembunny code from Part 1. Before executing the code, initialize register `c` to be 1. After executing the modified code, determine the final value in register `a`.

Input Format:
The input is a series of lines, each containing an assembunny code instruction.

input:
cpy 1 a
cpy 1 b
cpy 26 d
jnz c 2
jnz 1 5
cpy 7 c
inc d
dec c
jnz c -2
cpy a c
inc a
dec b
jnz b -2
cpy c b
dec d
jnz d -6
cpy 16 c
cpy 17 d
inc a
dec d
jnz d -2
dec c
jnz c -5
